N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 39.2 - Notice of opportunities

State Regulations
(a) Prior
to the awarding of any contract for the acquisition of goods or services of any
kind, other than employment in the civil service, in the actual or estimated
amount of $5,000 or more financed by monies received by the State from the sale
of bonds and/or notes pursuant to the Accelerated Capacity and Transportation

Improvements of the Nineties Bond Act, the department shall submit to the

Commissioner of Economic Development information sufficient to enable
publication of the notices of procurement contract opportunities in the

Procurement Opportunities Newsletter. Such information shall be submitted in
sufficient time to allow a minimum of 15 business days between publication of
such notice and the date on which a bid or proposal is due, except where a
shorter period is specifically authorized by law. (b) The department shall not award a
procurement contract so financed unless a notice of a procurement contract
opportunity had been published in the Procurement Opportunities Newsletter or
unless such procurement contract is exempted from the requirements for such
publication, as hereinafter set forth. (c) The provisions of this section shall not
apply to: (1)
procurement contracts awarded on
an emergency or critical need basis; (2)
procurement contracts being re-bid or
re-solicited for substantially the same goods or services within 45 business
days after the date bids or proposals were originally due; (3)
procurement contracts awarded pursuant to
section 175, 175-a, 175-b, or 175-c of the State Finance Law; (4)
procurement contracts awarded to
not-for-profit providers of human services. Notes
